page.title: 11STH WINGFIELD_AN ADULT'S DAY
page.content: {Mr. Cumberland lives in South {Wingfield and works at Taylor's Mill {built originally in 1681. I get up at 05.30, fill my flask, pick up my 'snap' and walk to work.On arrival I switch the steamer on for the 'pelleter' (to make pony food) then I 'sheet' the lorry which is used to deliver our products to our shops. I drive to the Ilkeston shop and unload the lorry. I deliver things like pellets, maize, sawdust, straw, dog and cat food and corn. I then travel to Smiths Flour Mill, Langley Mill and fetch a load of bran for return to Taylor's Mill. After that I mix more pellets until 20.00 hrs. Then I go home, have a meal and go out gardening. I watch television and go to bed at 22.00 hrs. 'SNAP' = PACKED LUNCH
